document.masterDocTitle: Checklist of the Red Sea Fishes with delineation of the Gulf of Suez, Gulf of Aqaba, endemism and Lessepsian migrants

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Checklist of the Red Sea Fishes with delineation of the Gulf of Suez, Gulf of Aqaba, endemism and Lessepsian migrants

subSubSection.paragraph:
Gulf of Suez :
Egypt (
Sanzo 1930, as
Aluteres monoceros
).

Gulf of Aqaba :
Jordan ( Khalaf & Disi 1997 ).
General distribution: Circumglobal in tropical and warm temperate seas.
Remark: Two specimens were recorded in the western Mediterranean Sea, probably entered via Gibraltar ( Guallart and Vicent 2009 ).

Gulf of Suez :
¯

Gulf of Aqaba :
Jordan ( Khalaf & Disi 1997 ).
General distribution: Circumglobal in tropical and warm temperate seas.

Gulf of Suez :
¯
Gulf of Aqaba: Egypt ( Lieske & Myers 2010 ), Jordan ( Khalaf & Disi 1997 ).

Red Sea main basin: Eritrea ( Tortonese 1956 ), Saudi Arabia (
Roux-Estève & Fourmanoir 1955, as
Thamnaconus penicularius
).
General distribution: Red Sea , Indo-West Pacific: East Africa east to Hawaiian Islands and Tuamotu Archipelago.

bibRefCitation.author: Clark, E. & Gohar, H. A. F.
bibRefCitation.refString: Clark, E. & Gohar, H. A. F. (1953) The fishes of the Red Sea: Order Plectognathi. Publications of the Marine Biological Station Al-Ghardaqa, Red Sea, 8, 1 - 80, 2 maps, pls. 1 - 5.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Gulf of Suez :
¯

Gulf of Aqaba :
¯

Red Sea main basin: Egypt (
Clark & Gohar 1953, as
Brachaluteres baueri fahaqa
).

General distribution:
Northern Red Sea
endemic.

Gulf of Suez :
Egypt (Rüppell 1837, as
Monacanthus pardalis
).

Gulf of Aqaba: Egypt ( Lieske & Myers 2010 ), Israel (
Ben-Tuvia & Steinitz 1952, as
Amanses sandwichiensis
), Jordan ( Khalaf & Disi 1997 ).

Red Sea main basin: Egypt (
Klunzinger 1871, as
Monacanthus pardalis
), Eritrea (
Picaglia 1895, as
Monacanthus pardalis
).
General distribution: Red Sea, Indo-West Pacific: East Africa east to southern Japan , Ogasawara Islands, Marquesas Islands and Pitcairn Group.

bibRefCitation.author: Marshall, N. B.
bibRefCitation.refString: Marshall, N. B. (1952) The " Manihine " expedition to the Gulf of Aqaba 1948 - 1949. IX. Fishes. Bulletin of the British Museum (Natural History), Zoology, 1 (8), 221 - 252.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Gulf of Suez :
¯
Gulf of Aqaba: Egypt ( Debelius 2007 ), ( Lieske & Myers 2010 ), Israel (Fishelson 1995).

Red Sea main basin: Egypt ( Marshall 1952 ), Sudan ( Edwards & Rosewell 1981 ), Saudi Arabia (
Roux-Estève & Fourmanoir 1955, as
Oxymonacanthus longirostris
).
General distribution: Red Sea endemic.

bibRefCitation.author: Clark, E. & Gohar, H. A. F.
bibRefCitation.refString: Clark, E. & Gohar, H. A. F. (1953) The fishes of the Red Sea: Order Plectognathi. Publications of the Marine Biological Station Al-Ghardaqa, Red Sea, 8, 1 - 80, 2 maps, pls. 1 - 5.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Gulf of Suez :
¯

Gulf of Aqaba :
¯
Red Sea main basin: Egypt ( Clark & Gohar 1953 ).

General distribution:
Red Sea , northwestern Indian Ocean
: Gulf of Aden .

Gulf of Suez :
Egypt (
Klausewitz 1983a, as
Paramonacanthus oblongus
).

Gulf of Aqaba: Israel (
Fowler & Steinitz 1956, as
Monacanthus cirrosus
).

Red Sea main basin: Egypt ( Clark & Gohar 1953 , as
Paramonacanthus oblongus
; Budker & Fourmanoir 1954 , as
Paramonacanthus barnardi
), Eritrea (
Kossmann & Räuber 1877, as
Monacanthus cirrosus
), Yemen (
Kotthaus 1979, as
Paramonacanthus
sp.
).
General distribution: Red Sea, western Indian Ocean: East Africa, Seychelles .

Gulf of Suez :
¯

Gulf of Aqaba :
Jordan (
Khalaf & Disi 1997, as
Paramonacanthus falcatus
).

bibRefCitation.author: Hutchins, J. B.
bibRefCitation.refString: Hutchins, J. B. (1986) Review of the monacanthid fish genus Pervagor, with descriptions of two new species. Indo-Pacific Fishes, 12, 1 - 35, pls. 1 - 2.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Gulf of Suez :
¯
Gulf of Aqaba: Israel ( Hutchins 1986 ), Jordan ( Khalaf & Disi 1997 ).

Red Sea main basin:
Sudan (
Clark & Gohar 1953, as
Pervagor melanocephalus
), Eritrea ( Kossmann & Räuber 1877 , as
Monacanthus melanocephalus
; Hutchins 1986 ).

General distribution:
Red Sea , northwestern Indian Ocean
: Gulf of Aden .

bibRefCitation.author: Fraser-Brunner, A.
bibRefCitation.refString: Fraser-Brunner, A. (1940) Notes on the plectognath fishes, III. On Monacanthus setifer Bennett and related species, with a key to the genus Stephanolepis and descriptions of four new species. Annals and Magazine of Natural History, Series 11, 5 (30), 518 - 535.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Gulf of Suez :
Egypt ( Tillier 1902 , as
Monacanthus setifer
; Sanzo 1930 , as
Stephanolepis hispidus
; Fraser-Brunner 1940 ).
General distribution: Red Sea, northwestern Indian Ocean: Gulf of Aden, Gulf of Oman , Persian Gulf.
Remark: Lessepsian migrant into eastern Mediterranean (see Ben-Tuvia 1966 ).

bibRefCitation.author: Bauchot, M. - L. & Mauge, A. L.
bibRefCitation.refString: Bauchot, M. - L. & Mauge, A. L. (1978) Premiere capture d'un Thamnaconus dans le golfe d'Aqaba: Thamnaconus modestoides erythraeenis n. ssp. (Pisces, Monacanthidae), 520. Bulletin du Museum National d'Histoire Naturelle, Serie 3 (Zoologie), 356, 539 - 545.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Gulf of Suez :
¯
General distribution: Red Sea endemic.
